title: Serghei Lașcencov
text:
Serghei Lașcencov (born 24 March 1980 in <a href="Zdolbuniv">Zdolbuniv</a>, <a href="Ukrainian%20Soviet%20Socialist%20Republic">Ukrainian SSR</a>) is a retired <a href="Moldova">Moldova</a>n <a href="Football%20%28soccer%29">footballer</a> and the former captain of the <a href="Moldova%20national%20football%20team">Moldovan national team</a>. In 2010, he was disqualified for five years for <a href="match-fixing">match-fixing</a>.
Career.
In the summer of 2008 Lașcencov moved to <a href="Azerbaijan%20Premier%20League">Azerbaijan Premier League</a> side <a href="AZAL%20PFC">Olimpik Baku</a> on an initial one-year contract. For the <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20AZAL%20PFC%20season">2009–10</a> season he was made captain of the team.
In August 2010, Lașcencov was given a lifetime ban from football for his involvement in the match-fixing surrounding <a href="FC%20Metalist%20Kharkiv">Metalist Kharkiv</a> and <a href="FC%20Karpaty%20Lviv">Karpaty Lviv</a>'s game on 19 April 2008 during the <a href="2007%E2%80%9308%20Ukrainian%20Premier%20League">2007–08 season</a>. On 17 October 2010, his ban was reduced to five years, a decision that was upheld by <a href="Court%20of%20Arbitration%20for%20Sport">CAS</a> in August 2013.
International career.
Lașcencov made his debut for <a href="Moldova%20national%20football%20team">Moldova</a> in 2004, going on to make 36 appearances and captain the team before his ban.
